channel.title: 6 - Knowledge Representation on
channel.description: Recent content in 6 - Knowledge Representation on

item.title: Agents
item.description: Independent programs/systems that each specialize in small tasks Focus: what can be done? Goals How does an agent perceive its environment?

item.title: Concept Maps
item.description: Extension of [[CS461 - Artificial Intelligence/6 - Knowledge Representation/Semantic Networks]] Key idea: show relationships between entities, tracing backwards/forwards to show how you arrived at a certain concept

item.title: Frames
item.description: Extension of [[CS461 - Artificial Intelligence/6 - Knowledge Representation/Object Orientation]] Frames are an artificial intelligence data structure used to divide knowledge into substructures by representing “stereotyped situations”.

item.title: Object Orientation
item.description: Key Ideas Inheritance Encapsulation Polymorphism Separate interface/implementation Languages Simula 67 Smalltalk

item.title: Production Systems
item.description: Idea: if-then rules Production systems require: control system (rules interpreter) database

item.title: Scripts
item.description: Idea Extension of [[CS461 - Artificial Intelligence/6 - Knowledge Representation/Frames]] adds information about sequences of events and planning Key concept: conceptual dependency #key-concept

item.title: Semantic Networks
item.description: Semantics: meaning Key idea: Model relationships between concepts, ideas, objects, events, or situations.
